translated: The Jātaka🔽The Collection of Long Discourses
The Chapter on One Who Desires What is Beneficial
The Jātaka of the Corrupter of Brahminical Sacrifices
“One who is not skilled in what is beneficial,
the practice of what is beneficial brings happiness;
The foolish one destroys what is beneficial,
like Koṇḍañña the corrupter of Brahminical sacrifices.”
The Jātaka of the Corrupter of Brahminical Sacrifices is the seventh.
